subject: Photography
title: Dynamic Range in Digital Cameras
description: A fast breakdown of Dynamic Range in Digital Cameras for builders.

hook.text: Your eyes see a sunlit window and a dark room at once. Your camera can't. That gap is dynamic range.

buildup.text: Dynamic range measures the span between the darkest shadow and brightest highlight a sensor can capture.

discovery.text: Modern sensors capture 12-15 stops of dynamic range â€” vastly more than early digital cameras managed.

twist.text: HDR techniques combine multiple exposures to exceed a single sensor's range â€” but risk looking artificial.

climax.text: Higher dynamic range means fewer blown highlights and crushed shadows. The image retains detail across the full scene.

punchline.text: The best sensor sees both the shadow and the light.

quiz.question: What does dynamic range measure in a camera?
options: The span between the darkest and brightest details a sensor can capture
